name: 1,3-Diphenylpropane-1,3-dione
Reason: 1,3-Diphenylpropane-1,3-dione has a melting point influenced by the functional groups in the molecule relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The presence of two phenyl groups contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20°C per group, totaling +40°C. The carbonyl group introduces a polar carbonyl interaction, raising the melting point by approximately +30°C. The dione functional group introduces a rigid structure that can participate in dipole interactions, increasing the melting point by approximately +20°C.
